content:
• Thursday, March 8, 2012
  • NES

    More on Heckmann Corporation (HEK): Q4 misses on both EPS and revenue as earnings were...

    More on Heckmann Corporation (HEK): Q4 misses on both EPS and revenue as earnings were negatively impacted by higher operational expenses and impairment charges. The company also lowers estimates for Q1, now anticipating total revenues of $54M versus the consensus of $58M. Shares -4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:15 PM
  • COO

    More on Cooper Companies (NYSE:COO): FQ1 beat estimates on strong sales from all business...

    More on Cooper Companies (NYSE:COO): FQ1 beat estimates on strong sales from all business segments. Earnings rose 39% Y/Y as the maker of contact lenses and medical instruments continues to experience surging revenue growth. The company also raises its current-year earnings forecast, now expecting to earn between $4.90 - $5.15 per share. +5.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:59 PM
  • FSIN

    More on Fushi Copperweld (NASDAQ:FSIN): Q4 misses on all counts. Gross profit declined Y/Y on...

    More on Fushi Copperweld (NASDAQ:FSIN): Q4 misses on all counts. Gross profit declined Y/Y on lower sales volumes and higher raw material prices. The company also guides its FY12 lower, now seeing its EPS between $0.76 - $0.86 versus the Street view of $1.13. Shares -3.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:49 PM
  • DHI

    One options trader places a big bet that D.R. Horton’s (NYSE:DHI) rally is over,...

    One options trader places a big bet that D.R. Horton’s (NYSE:DHI) rally is over, “someone with a strong belief the stock’s going to go down," the head of equity derivatives trading at MKM Partners says. “When you see a trade of this size, it’s usually savvy money." Homebuilder stocks have been hot, as the XHB ETF has surged 61% since Oct. 3; DHI has jumped 72% during the period.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 PM | 3 Comments
  • TPCG

    TPC Group (NASDAQ:TPCG): Q4 EPS of -$1.18 beats by $0.16. Revenue of $575M (+18% Y/Y) beats by...

    TPC Group (NASDAQ:TPCG): Q4 EPS of -$1.18 beats by $0.16. Revenue of $575M (+18% Y/Y) beats by $101M. Shares -2.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • NES

    Heckmann (HEK): Q4 EPS of $0.00 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $51.6M misses by $2M. Shares -5.5%...

    Heckmann (HEK): Q4 EPS of $0.00 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $51.6M misses by $2M. Shares -5.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (NASDAQ:GMCR), at one point down over 20% AH thanks to Starbucks'...

    Green Mountain Coffee (NASDAQ:GMCR), at one point down over 20% AH thanks to Starbucks' (NASDAQ:SBUX) single-cup announcement, has pared its losses after Starbucks uses a conference call (webcast) to state its Verismo machine and pods will coexist with Green Mountain's Keurig brewers and K-Cups. Nonetheless, shares are still down 13.7%. Starbucks, meanwhile, is now up 4.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM | 3 Comments
  • EBS

    Emergent Biosolutions (NYSE:EBS): Q4 EPS of $0.78 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $108M (+4.6% Y/Y)...

    Emergent Biosolutions (NYSE:EBS): Q4 EPS of $0.78 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $108M (+4.6% Y/Y) misses by $1M. Shares +2.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • ARR

    ARMOUR Residential REIT (NYSE:ARR) -2.8% AH after announcing a 26M share stock offering, good...

    ARMOUR Residential REIT (NYSE:ARR) -2.8% AH after announcing a 26M share stock offering, good for proceeds of $185M based on today's close. The company plans to use the proceeds to buy additional mortgage-backed securities.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM | 7 Comments
  • CMTL

    Comtech Telecommunications (NASDAQ:CMTL): FQ2 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $99.1M...

    Comtech Telecommunications (NASDAQ:CMTL): FQ2 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $99.1M (-39.1% Y/Y) beats by $6M. Shares +3.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM
  • ALJ

    Alon USA Energy (NYSE:ALJ): Q4 EPS of -$0.23 may not be comparable to consensus of -$0.13....

    Alon USA Energy (NYSE:ALJ): Q4 EPS of -$0.23 may not be comparable to consensus of -$0.13. Revenue of $1.88B (+38% Y/Y) misses by $40M. Shares -3.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM
  • AOBC

    Smith & Wesson (SWHC): FQ3 EPS of $0.07 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $98.1M (+23.9% Y/Y) beats...

    Smith & Wesson (SWHC): FQ3 EPS of $0.07 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $98.1M (+23.9% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares +5.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM | 6 Comments
  • TXN

    Texas Instruments (NYSE:TXN) -2.1% AH after using its mid-quarter update to guide for Q1 revenue...

    Texas Instruments (NYSE:TXN) -2.1% AH after using its mid-quarter update to guide for Q1 revenue of $2.99B-$3.11B ($3.02B-$3.28B prior) and EPS of $0.15-$0.19 ($0.16-$0.24 prior). The chipmaker cites lower demand for wireless products, though it doesn't clarify whether the products are its application processors or baseband chips - TI is winding down the latter business. A CC starts at 5PM ET (webcast).

     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZQK

    Quiksilver (NYSE:ZQK): FQ1 EPS of -$0.14 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $449.6M (+5.4% Y/Y) beats...

    Quiksilver (NYSE:ZQK): FQ1 EPS of -$0.14 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $449.6M (+5.4% Y/Y) beats by $12M. Shares -1.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • FSIN

    Fushi Copperweld (NASDAQ:FSIN): Q4 EPS of $0.15 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $68.2M (-2.4% Y/Y)...

    Fushi Copperweld (NASDAQ:FSIN): Q4 EPS of $0.15 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $68.2M (-2.4% Y/Y) misses by $2M. Shares -6.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • BODY

    Body Central (OTCQB:BODY): Q4 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $80.7M (+20.4% Y/Y)...

    Body Central (OTCQB:BODY): Q4 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $80.7M (+20.4% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -15.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • SONC

    Sonic (SONC -6.8%) tumbled in late trading after announcing ahead of a Merrill conference...

    Sonic (SONC -6.8%) tumbled in late trading after announcing ahead of a Merrill conference (slides - .pdf) its FQ2 same-store sales rose 3.4% Y/Y. Same-store sales rose 0.1% in FQ1.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • ARO

    Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO): Q4 EPS of $0.44 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $808M (-3.7% Y/Y) beats by...

    Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO): Q4 EPS of $0.44 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $808M (-3.7% Y/Y) beats by $4M. Shares -2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • COO

    Cooper Companies (NYSE:COO): FQ1 EPS of $1.12 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $326M (+11.2% Y/Y)...

    Cooper Companies (NYSE:COO): FQ1 EPS of $1.12 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $326M (+11.2% Y/Y) beats by $9M. Shares +3.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • SBUX

    Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) announces its Verismo single-cup coffee system, through which the...

    Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) announces its Verismo single-cup coffee system, through which the company says it's targeting "global leadership" in the market. Starbucks will sell the Verismo in its stores, along with Starbucks-sourced coffee and milk pods. No details are provided about pricing and launch date. Starbucks is largely unchanged AH, but partner and single-cup market leader Green Mountain Coffee (NASDAQ:GMCR) is down 16.7%. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 4 Comments
  • NVLN

    Aegerion Pharmaceuticals (AEGR +8.5%) says the FDA has provided a clear and executable pathway...

    Aegerion Pharmaceuticals (AEGR +8.5%) says the FDA has provided a clear and executable pathway for the company to file a New Drug Application for its lead investigational therapeutic, lomitapide, based upon Phase III clinical trial results in 29 patients with HoFH, with a primary endpoint of LDL-C reduction.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • RLJ

    RLJ Lodging Trust (RLJ +2.6%) gains on an upgrade to Buy on valuation at Janney Capital on the...

    RLJ Lodging Trust (RLJ +2.6%) gains on an upgrade to Buy on valuation at Janney Capital on the back of its better than expected Q4 results and guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • HALO

    Halozyme Therapeutics (HALO +3.7%) moves higher after Barclays initiates coverage with a Buy...

    Halozyme Therapeutics (HALO +3.7%) moves higher after Barclays initiates coverage with a Buy rating and $15 price target. Analyst Ying Huang highlights the firm's proven "proof-of-concept" for multiple molecules and promising pipeline. Shares are up 22% YTD and trade just below 52-week highs.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM
  • S

    Sprint (S +7.8%) shares surge after Wells Fargo says the no. 3 wireless operator is picking up...

    Sprint (S +7.8%) shares surge after Wells Fargo says the no. 3 wireless operator is picking up subscribers from AT&T (NYSE:T) and T-Mobile (OTCQX:DTEGY). AT&T has hiked prices on smartphone data plans for new subscribers and has set caps on heavy data users; getting the iPhone last year also has helped Sprint gain users from T-Mobile.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM | 4 Comments
  • STM

    STMicroelectronics (STM +6.2%) gains on an upgrade to Neutral from Underperform at Exane BNP...

    STMicroelectronics (STM +6.2%) gains on an upgrade to Neutral from Underperform at Exane BNP Paribas.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • MCD

    CNBC's Herb Greenberg and James Cramer are making McDonald's (MCD -3.2%) a battleground stock...

    CNBC's Herb Greenberg and James Cramer are making McDonald's (MCD -3.2%) a battleground stock all on their own. Cramer says he's a buyer because these sell-offs are "somewhat typical" on boilerplate worries, while Greenberg keeps pounding the table that shares of Mickey D's have peaked.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM | 5 Comments
  • STMP

    Stamps.com (STMP +13.5%) soars after disclosing it has settled its patent dispute with...

    Stamps.com (STMP +13.5%) soars after disclosing it has settled its patent dispute with privately-held PSI Systems, and entered into a cross-licensing agreement. No payments will be made as part of the deal, and each company has agreed not to sue the other for infringement for the next 5 years.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • VHC

    VirnetX (VHC +5.4%) trades up on positive comments out of Cowen today, saying it values the...

    VirnetX (VHC +5.4%) trades up on positive comments out of Cowen today, saying it values the company's patents at $2.4B - $3.2B and sees licensing opportunities as LTE-A products begin to ship. The firm also notes the stock's recent volatility and attributes it to speculation of an impending Markman ruling.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • SPR

    Shares of Spirit AeroSystems Holdings (SPR +5.6%) gain, helped out by bullish comments from...

    Shares of Spirit AeroSystems Holdings (SPR +5.6%) gain, helped out by bullish comments from Jefferies at an investor meeting. The firm says the stock is a good conduit to bet on the growth in civil aircraft production, as it maintains a Buy rating and $28 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • ARUN

    Aruba (ARUN +5.4%) is upped to Outperform at William Blair, which says BYOD - bring your own...

    Aruba (ARUN +5.4%) is upped to Outperform at William Blair, which says BYOD - bring your own device - is is only getting stronger, "creating a paradigm shift in the way IT managers think about their networks and the devices, operating systems and applications they need to support... This should sustain and potentially accelerate demand for WLAN solutions and puts Aruba in the catbird seat."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • LULU

    Lululemon (LULU +3.3%) gains on positive comments out of Cowen today. Cowen says the company...

    Lululemon (LULU +3.3%) gains on positive comments out of Cowen today. Cowen says the company continues to see a favorable risk/reward scenario, citing new product innovation, solid store sales per square foot, and brand awareness. The firm rates the shares at Outperform.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM | 2 Comments
  • HOV

    Home builders add to yesterday's rally sparked by optimistic talk from Hovnanian (HOV +10.2%)...

    Home builders add to yesterday's rally sparked by optimistic talk from Hovnanian (HOV +10.2%) that spring selling is off to a strong start, with 38% Y/Y growth in net contracts and home prices remaining relatively stable. Builders KBH +5.7%, LEN +4.8%, PHM +4.8%. Retailers HD +1%, LOW +1.5%. But James Brumley cautions: Is the industry getting better, or just not getting any worse?

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • DRWI

    DragonWave (DRWI -5.8%) drops after Avian cut the shares to Negative with a $3 price target,...

    DragonWave (DRWI -5.8%) drops after Avian cut the shares to Negative with a $3 price target, citing integration risk and overly optimistic financial targets relating to its NSN deal.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • STP

    Suntech Power (STP -1.4%) dips after reporting a mixed Q4, beating on revenue but missing on a...

    Suntech Power (STP -1.4%) dips after reporting a mixed Q4, beating on revenue but missing on a per share basis. Earnings swung to a loss as the solar-panel maker reported higher operating expenses, softer revenue and higher foreign exchange losses.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • AUO

    AU Optronics (AUO +2.1%) follows the tech sector higher after reporting February sales of $948M...

    AU Optronics (AUO +2.1%) follows the tech sector higher after reporting February sales of $948M - up 29% M/M and 3% Y/Y, and further evidence of improving conditions for the LCD panel market. Strong shipment growth was seen for both large and small panels. Also rallying are rival LG Display (LPL +2.6%) and LCD glass supplier Corning (GLW +2.1% - previously).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • STEI

    Stewart Enterprises (STEI -1.6%) dips after its FQ1 misses on all counts. Earnings actually rose...

    Stewart Enterprises (STEI -1.6%) dips after its FQ1 misses on all counts. Earnings actually rose 6.2% Y/Y but the funeral- services company's latest core earnings still disappointed as revenue slumped.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • ABT

    Abbott Laboratories (ABT +2.4%) trades higher after receiving FDA clearance to sell its...

    Abbott Laboratories (ABT +2.4%) trades higher after receiving FDA clearance to sell its FreeStyle InsuLinx system for monitoring blood glucose levels. InsuLinx, which is already available for sale in Canada and several European countries, is the first glucose monitoring system from Abbott to feature a touchscreen and automated logbook.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM
  • GMCR

    Mirroring an earlier take from JPMorgan on Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -3.7%), SunTrust...

    Mirroring an earlier take from JPMorgan on Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -3.7%), SunTrust says the concern over Starbucks' upcoming announcement via a webcast (live stream) slated for later today is overblown. Analyst William Chappell recommends buying the dip, seeing a potential positive catalyst for GMCR coming out of the event.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • SFD

    Smithfield Foods (SFD -1.3%) execs hit a number of topics on an earnings CC ranging from the...

    Smithfield Foods (SFD -1.3%) execs hit a number of topics on an earnings CC ranging from the firm's increased tie-in to NASCAR to the upside that free trade agreements will have for exports, but the headliner may be the CFO's revelation that bankers are again pitching Sara Lee's (SLE +0.8%) meat business to it. "I don't think necessarily we'll have to go to the table. I think the table will come to us."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM
  • SMRT

    Stein Mart (SMRT -7.6%) dips after its Q4 EPS misses the mark. Earnings sank 70% as the clothing...

    Stein Mart (SMRT -7.6%) dips after its Q4 EPS misses the mark. Earnings sank 70% as the clothing and home furnishings retailer reported weaker same-store and overall sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • CCI

    BofA/Merrill raises its price target to $60 on Crown Castle (CCI +2.5%), citing its S&P 500...

    BofA/Merrill raises its price target to $60 on Crown Castle (CCI +2.5%), citing its S&P 500 index inclusion and improved tower leasing demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • ALXA

    Shares of Alexza Pharmaceuticals (ALXA +7.1%) trade higher on heavy volume after seeing Grupo...

    Shares of Alexza Pharmaceuticals (ALXA +7.1%) trade higher on heavy volume after seeing Grupo Ferrer pony up for 2.4 shares. The deal was tit-for-tat, with Alexza agreeing to eliminate milestone payments it was in line to receive on sales of its schizophrenic and bipolar disorder treatment Adasuve.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • ORN

    Orion Marine (ORN +4.2%) gains after saying it's been awarded a contract for up to $50M with the...

    Orion Marine (ORN +4.2%) gains after saying it's been awarded a contract for up to $50M with the Mobile District of the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • CIEN

    Ciena (CIEN +4.3%) is raised to Buy at Stifel Nicolaus, which says industry contacts at a trade...

    Ciena (CIEN +4.3%) is raised to Buy at Stifel Nicolaus, which says industry contacts at a trade show this week were enthusiastic about upgrading to faster infrastructure. CIEN is seeing robust demand despite signs of weak telecom spending in certain parts of the network, which "syncs with our view that being exposed to the right area in terms of customer spending priorities is important."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • SPR

    Spirit Aerosystems (SPR +4.1%) rallies after Jefferies issues a bullish note following recent...

    Spirit Aerosystems (SPR +4.1%) rallies after Jefferies issues a bullish note following recent analyst meetings (slides - .pdf). The firm notes management believes it can grow the aircraft component maker's annual revenue to $6.3B in 2014 - up sharply from 2011's $4.86B, as well as a 2012 consensus of $5.35B.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • OCLR

    Oclaro (OCLR +15%) jumps after BWS Financial upped the shares to Buy earlier today. The firm...

    Oclaro (OCLR +15%) jumps after BWS Financial upped the shares to Buy earlier today. The firm says the down cycle that came at the beginning of 2011 for optical component companies seems to have subsided, and the industry could see a lift over the next two years.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • TPR

    Coach (COH +6.4%) leads S&P gainers after CEO Lew Frankfort tells a BofA conference that the...

    Coach (COH +6.4%) leads S&P gainers after CEO Lew Frankfort tells a BofA conference that the retailer is enjoying an excellent quarter, business is trending extremely well and building on momentum from Q2. COH says it has much room for growth as 90% of sales come from North America and Japan only; business in China continues extremely strong.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • UFPI

    Universal Forest Products (UFPI +4.3%) jumps following an upgrade to Neutral from D.A. Davidson....

    Universal Forest Products (UFPI +4.3%) jumps following an upgrade to Neutral from D.A. Davidson. The firm notes shares have fallen sharply in recent weeks even though the outlook for the housing market hasn't changed, and declares Universal to be "a solid company with good operations, a strong balance sheet and a profitable business model."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • OPLK

    Oplink Communications (OPLK +4%) moves higher after being upgraded to Buy at BWS Financial,...

    Oplink Communications (OPLK +4%) moves higher after being upgraded to Buy at BWS Financial, citing improving demand for for optical component companies.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • XSRAY

    A unit of Swiss mining giant Xstrata (OTC:XSRAY +2%) agrees to acquire a Canadian coal deposit...

    A unit of Swiss mining giant Xstrata (OTC:XSRAY +2%) agrees to acquire a Canadian coal deposit from Talisman Energy (TLM +0.9%) for $500M in cash. The Sukunka coking coal deposit in British Columbia, which has an estimated 236M metric tons of resources, will "meaningfully increase our exposure to hard coking coal," the company says.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • JMBA

    Shares of Jamba (JMBA -5.2%) trade lower on profit taking after beating Q4 estimates late...

    Shares of Jamba (JMBA -5.2%) trade lower on profit taking after beating Q4 estimates late yesterday. The company saw a 4.1% increase in traffic during the quarter, driven by warm winter weather and recent product introductions, such as oatmeal, breakfast wraps, frozen yogurt, and smoothies.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • MSFT

    A number of select employment-related stocks are running hot after the rise in jobless claims...

    A number of select employment-related stocks are running hot after the rise in jobless claims doesn't alter the general perception that the labor market is trending positive. Also in the mix, M&A speculation stirred up last week on word that Monster Worldwide was exploring strategic alternative and more chatter this week that LinkedIn could be taking a look. Gainers: LNKD +5.5%, MWW +3.8%, KELYA +3.1%, MAN +2.8%, DHX +5.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM | 3 Comments
  • JOE

    Florida real estate developer St. Joe (JOE +4%) catches a bid after appointing Thomas Hoyer to...

    Florida real estate developer St. Joe (JOE +4%) catches a bid after appointing Thomas Hoyer to the position of CFO. Hoye, previously CFO of eDiets.com, is replacing Janna Connolly, who is resigning to "pursue other opportunities."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM | 2 Comments
  • CLVS

    Recent IPO Clovis Oncology (CLVS -9.8%) takes a hit after posting a $14.9M Q4 loss, despite...

    Recent IPO Clovis Oncology (CLVS -9.8%) takes a hit after posting a $14.9M Q4 loss, despite showing improvement over the prior year period. Bottom line margins were hit as R&D expenses nearly doubled due to the expanded development activities for its CO-101 and CO-1686 drugs, as well as the in-licensing of Rucaparib from Pfizer in mid 2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • GILD

    Shares of drug companies that produce HIV treatments move up on news that three clinical trials...

    Shares of drug companies that produce HIV treatments move up on news that three clinical trials suggest healthy people should take HIV drugs to prevent infection with the virus that causes AIDS. The big winner would be Gilead Sciences (GILD +2.2%), which makes the first HIV treatment the FDA is reviewing for possible marketing as a preventative measure.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • FSYS

    Fuel Systems Solutions (FSYS -5.6%) trades lower after misfiring with its Q4 report as it...

    Fuel Systems Solutions (FSYS -5.6%) trades lower after misfiring with its Q4 report as it reports a lower-than-expected profit. The company issues guidance for full year 2012 revenue of $420M to $440M that represents a midpoint below that of the consensus sales estimate of analysts calling for $437.3M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) fall off 2.7% after Starbucks (SBUX...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) fall off 2.7% after Starbucks (SBUX +1.7%) says that it will make a strategic initiative announcement later today. Analysts with JPMorgan call the reaction a bit overdone, as they don't see the SBUX news (possibly Europe related) as coming in anti-competitive to GMCR.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • JPM

    Morgan Stanley hikes its price target for JPMorgan Chase (JPM +1.4%) shares to $45 and raises...

    Morgan Stanley hikes its price target for JPMorgan Chase (JPM +1.4%) shares to $45 and raises its earnings estimates for the bank, citing higher margins and improved loan growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM

  • EIA Natural Gas Inventory: -80 bcf vs. consensus of -84 bcf. Futures +0.5% to $2.31.

    EIA Natural Gas Inventory: -80 bcf vs. consensus of -84 bcf. Futures +0.5% to $2.31.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • NAV

    Navistar (NAV -5.8%) shares sink after reporting a handful of one-time expenses and production...

    Navistar (NAV -5.8%) shares sink after reporting a handful of one-time expenses and production issues that led to a FQ1 loss, though revenue continued to rise. The truck and engine maker is cutting its 2012 EPS forecast to $4.25-$5.25, vs. $5.37 consensus and down from its prior forecast of $5-$5.75, citing higher healthcare costs as well as trouble at a brake supplier.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • MCD

    It's the weather: McDonald's (MCD -3.4%) pulls out the weather excuse to pass off its...

    It's the weather: McDonald's (MCD -3.4%) pulls out the weather excuse to pass off its disappointing sales in Europe, joining a widespread number of companies blaming Mother Nature for results as of late. While a mild winter in the U.S. and a severe season in parts of Europe can't be overlooked, cynics note that it's usually only the downside results that bring the weather into the discussion.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM | 2 Comments
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN -2.7%) continues its downward slide, and Morningstar is the latest to register its...

    Groupon (GRPN -2.7%) continues its downward slide, and Morningstar is the latest to register its disrespect: "Groupon's business can easily be replicated... Customers and merchants have no switching costs... The firm has no meaningful intangible assets, and it doesn't enjoy network effects... The firm also does not have a cost advantage."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM | 3 Comments
  • DNDN

    Deutsche Bank sticks to its guns on Dendreon (DNDN -16.1%) despite the sharp selloff off of news...

    Deutsche Bank sticks to its guns on Dendreon (DNDN -16.1%) despite the sharp selloff off of news that Johnson & Johnson's prostate cancer drug is a go. Analysts with Deutsche not only maintain a Buy rating while keeping their outlook for sales of Provenge in place, they make the call to buy shares into weakness.
